mdRecord.dcterms:description: A Latin phrase that appears to mean 'truly bright suns shone for you,' possibly a line from a poem by Gaius Valerius Catullus. A German phrase reminiscent of the phrase found at the gate of Auschwitz ('Arbeit Macht Frei'), but adapted to an academic setting, with 'Arbeit' ('work') replaced with "Studieren" ('to study'). [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
Fulgere vere candida tibi soles | Studieren Macht Frei
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Quotations, Latin

World War, 1939-1945
